page.title: 01General Description.
page.content: The area is rural and almost totally devoted to farming activities. Its position is somewhat remote being served by only two minor roads off, major routes but, the area is well blessed with foot and bridle paths. The underlying chalk and clay have influenced the farming type, much of the area being a mix of the two, the resulting lighter soil being ideal for both arable farming (mainly spring and winter wheat and oil seed rape) and the raising of soft fruits and orchards. These activities are found on the higher parts where there is a ridge. The lower areas are mostly heavy clay and more suited to pastoral farming (mostly the fattening of beef cattle). Several wooded areas occur in the region, remnants of old forests that started life not long after the last Ice Age.
